qas.question: What is the only Tipitaka to survive intact in its original language?
Is is said that some early schools of buddhism had how many pitakas?

context: The <a0_0>Pāli Tipitaka<a0_0/> is the only early Tipitaka (Sanskrit: Tripiṭaka) to survive intact in its original language, but a number of early schools had their own recensions of the Tipitaka featuring much of the same material. We have portions of the Tipitakas of the Sārvāstivāda, Dharmaguptaka, Sammitya, Mahāsaṅghika, Kāśyapīya, and Mahīśāsaka schools, most of which survive in Chinese translation only. According to some sources, some early schools of Buddhism had <a1_0>five or seven<a1_0/> pitakas.
